sense.gloss: the Snake (sixth sign of the Chinese zodiac), the Serpent
hour of the Snake (around 10am, 9-11am, or 10am-12 noon)
fourth month of the lunar calendar
Earth Snake (6th term of the sexagenary cycle, e.g. 1929, 1989, 2049)
Doll's Festival (March 3), Girls' Festival, Peach Festival
x: ひな祭り・ひなまつり

sense.gloss: first Serpent day of the year
purification ceremony held on the first day of the snake in the 3rd month of the lunar calendar
Metal Snake (18th term of the sexagenary cycle, e.g. 1941, 2001, 2061)
Water Snake (30th term of the sexagenary cycle, e.g. 1953, 2013, 2073)
Wood Snake (42nd term of the sexagenary cycle, e.g. 1905, 1965, 2025)
Fire Snake (54th term of the sexagenary cycle, e.g. 1917, 1977, 2037)
geisha from the Fukagawa red-light district in Edo
hour of the Snake (around 10am, 9-11am, or 10am-12 noon), hour of the Serpent

sdata.j: ↑克巳↑↓かつみ↓は↑自分↑↓じぶん↓の↑思↑↓おも↓い↑通↑↓どお↓りにするのが↑許↑↓ゆる↓されないと、すぐ↑腹↑↓はら↓をたてる。
sdata.e: If Katsumi is not allowed to have his own way, he easily gets angry.

sdata.j: ↑克巳↑↓かつみ↓は↑自分↑↓じぶん↓の↑思↑↓おも↓い↑通↑↓どお↓りにするのが↑許↑↓ゆる↓されないと、すぐ↑腹↑↓はら↓をたてる。
sdata.e: If Katsumi doesn't get his own way, he gets angry right away.

sdata.j: 「トムとジョンって↑一卵性双生児↑↓いちらんせいそうせいじ↓とは↑聞↑↓き↓いてたけど、↑本当↑↓ほんとう↓によく↑似↑↓に↓てるよね？」「↑似↑↓に↓てる↑似↑↓に↓てる。↑親↑↓おや↓にも↑時々↑↓ときどき↓↑間違↑↓まちが↓えられるって↑言↑↓い↓ってたよ。あの↑二人↑↓ふたり↓はほんと、↑已↑↓い↓↑己↑↓こ↓↑巳↑↓み↓↑己↑↓き↓だよ」
sdata.e: I heard that Tom and John are identical twins. They really do look alike, don't they? "Yes, they really do look very similar. Even their parents say they get confused sometimes. Those two really are very similar, aren't they?"

meanings: sign of the snake or serpent
sign of the snake or serpent
